tool.name: ReductionToPole

param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: Input total magnetic intensity (TMI) raster dataset for reduction to pole transformation.

param.name: inclination
param.dialogReference: Magnetic field inclination at survey location (-90 to +90 degrees). Obtain from IGRF model for survey date and location.

param.name: declination
param.dialogReference: Magnetic field declination at survey location (-180 to +180 degrees). Obtain from IGRF model for survey date and location.

param.name: buffer_size
param.dialogReference: Buffer zone size for edge effect reduction during frequency domain processing.

tool.summary: Transform magnetic data to polar coordinates for simplified interpretation
tool.usage:
Reduction to pole transforms magnetic data to appear as if measured at the magnetic pole (90° inclination). This centers magnetic anomalies directly over their causative sources and simplifies interpretation.

Requirements:

• Accurate magnetic inclination and declination values

• Values should be from IGRF model for survey date and location

• Total magnetic intensity (TMI) data

Warning: May be unstable at very low magnetic latitudes (|inclination| < 15°)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Reduction to pole transforms magnetic data to polar coordinates, centering anomalies over their sources. Essential for magnetic interpretation, especially at low magnetic latitudes.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Simplification of magnetic anomaly interpretation by removing effects of magnetic field inclination and declination.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Baranov & Naudy (1964), Blakely (1995) - Potential Theory in Gravity and Magnetic Applications
dataIdInfo.useLimit: Requires accurate magnetic inclination and declination values. May be unstable at very low magnetic latitudes (|inclination| < 15°). High-frequency noise should be reduced before transformation.
